intro: Nebra rudifolia, commonly known as the rough-leaved sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Crambe. It is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit and is native to arctic and alpine regions of Europe and Asia. The plant features small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are typically rough in texture and have a distinctive, narrow shape. Nebra rudifolia thrives in well-drained, sandy or rocky soils and is often found in mountainous or coastal environments.
